summary: This is an internal email chain from July 2021 regarding a voicemail from Congresswoman Frankel about the Epstein case. The email discusses routing the request to OLA (Office of Legislative Affairs) and mentions attorney Jack Scarola as an intermediary who provided a contact's cellphone number to congressional staff.

persons.name: Congresswoman Frankel
persons.context: Left a voicemail regarding the Epstein case, prompting this internal email discussion about routing the request.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Represented an unspecified party and informed the email recipient that someone from Congress had reached out about the Epstein case, providing the recipient's cellphone number.

connections.description: Scarola informed the email recipient that Frankel's office had reached out to him about the Epstein case, indicating a professional communication channel.
Scarola provided the recipient's cellphone number to congressional staff, suggesting a prior professional relationship or case involvement.

events.title: Voicemail from Congresswoman Frankel
events.description: Congresswoman Frankel left a voicemail on a staffer's cellphone regarding the Epstein case, which was then discussed internally via email.

keyFacts: Congressional interest in the Epstein case continued as of July 2021, with Congresswoman Frankel directly reaching out.
Attorney Jack Scarola acted as an intermediary, providing a contact's cellphone number to congressional staff.
The email discusses internal routing of the congressional inquiry to the Office of Legislative Affairs (OLA).
